intro: Tragacantha eschkerensis, commonly known as the Eschker's tragacanth, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant produces a resinous sap, which has been historically used in traditional medicine and as a natural adhesive. Tragacantha eschkerensis thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for various desert organisms.
